name: 2-chloro-1-phenylsulfonamidobenzene
source: RAEVSKY OA; PERLOVICH GL and SCHAPER K-J. Physicochemical properties/descriptors governing the solubility and partitioning of chemicals in water-solvent-gas systems. Part 2. Solubility in 1-octanol. SAR and QSAR in Environmental Research Vol. 18 Nos. 5–6 July–September 2007 543–578
Reason: The compound 2-chloro-1-phenylsulfonamidobenzene has a basic benzene ring with a chlorine atom attached, a sulfonamide group, and a phenyl group. The chlorine atom increases the melting point due to its high electronegativity and the resulting increased intermolecular forces. The sulfonamide group can also increase the melting point due to its polarity and potential for hydrogen bonding. The phenyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its conjugation and potential for pi-pi interactions.
